intro: Thespesiopsis mossambicensis, commonly known as the African flame tree, is a deciduous tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Bignoniaceae family and is characterized by its striking orange-red flowers that bloom in clusters during the dry season. The plant has compound leaves with ovate to lanceolate leaflets and produces woody pods that contain seeds. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular ornamental species in tropical and subtropical regions.
